metadata.title: CVE-2018-14779 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - high
metadata.description:
A buffer overflow issue was discovered in the Yubico-Piv 1.5.0 smartcarddriver. The file lib/ykpiv.c contains the following code in the function`ykpiv_transfer_data()`: {% highlight c %} if(*out_len + recv_len - 2 >max_out) { fprintf(stderr, "Output buffer to small, wanted to write %lu,max was %lu.", *out_len + recv_len - 2, max_out); } if(out_data) {memcpy(out_data, data, recv_len - 2); out_data += recv_len - 2; *out_len +=recv_len - 2; } {% endhighlight %} -- it is clearly checked whether thebuffer is big enough to hold the data copied using `memcpy()`, but no errorhandling happens to avoid the `memcpy()` in such cases. This code path canbe triggered with malicious data coming from a smartcard.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-14779` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libykpiv1 - 1.7.0-1
ykcs11 - 1.7.0-1
yubico-piv-tool - 1.7.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: yubico-piv-tool package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.7.0-1').
